title: Would it be illegal to sell "Elo boosts" as a dynamic que 4 man?
body:
? As far as riot is concerned dynamic que elo boosting is fine so why can't premades just make smurfs and sell elo boosts to people?

Is there something I'm missing about this or did riot just legalize elo boosting.

Basically 4 people who are gold/plat/dia/master could easily boost bronze and silver accounts up especially on smurfs and it's legal as far as I can tell.

replies.body: Nope. Dynamic Boost is entirely legal.
Well, assuming that you leveled your smurfs manually, then yeah.
Elo Boosting is Legal now.

It's not boosting if the client is playing, he's still climbing up the ladder himself, just with the help of "friends"

Elo boosting is when you have a friend or booster play on your account for you to get the account a higher rating, and sharing accounts is against the rules.

> [{quoted}](name=BLLLK FLLG,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PKxg65oM,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2016-04-29T17:43:53.355+0000)

The effect is the same. He gains an elo level he doesn't deserve because he paid for it.

I'm not saying it's ok I'm just saying it's not against the rules to my knowledge, it's not account sharing or the use of flagged 3rd party programs 

Maybe the rules will get updated if this starts to become a problem, like they'll ban smurfs and do a wide account ban like they do with bots.

I dunno it doesn't seem fair but it's not against the rules if you wanna invest the time and money into getting help ranking up with mercenary's, riot atm has no qualms against it (to my knowledge)

So what you're saying is it is boosting in spirit but not within the summoners code.

The thing is: it's boosting when someone else plays on your account for you.
It's not boosting if you're playing on your account with someone better than you and they help you getting a higher rank.

If that was considered boosting, the entire idea of dynamic Q (playing ranked games with friends) would have been against Riot's rules.

It is boosting, period.

Whenever it's aganist rules is a different thing.

No, it's not.
The term "boosting" according to Riot Games has a very specific meaning and it's the one that I described.

We don't make the rules and we don't choose the meaning of the words that are commonly used.
This was possible before as well with duo q nothing new

But it's easier within a dynamic because you can control more teammate skill variable, in duo queue you still had to account for 3 strangers.

In Dynamic, you can boost in teams, which means consistency is more prevalent.

>But it's easier within a dynamic because you can control more teammate skill variable, in duo queue you still had to account for 3 strangers

This is 2016, Man! Fuck Competitive integrity if it means people are less toxic and play with friends! - Riot

You can smurf and help someone out but:

* You aren't doing them a favour since they will end up in a ELO they don't belong in and they will drop hard after. They will ruin a lot of games for other people when they start bombing.
* You can't charge money on it since it's against the terms & conditions.

> You can't charge money on it since it's against the terms & conditions.

Riot can't prove or disprove this factor, so nobody will ever get banned for it **unless Riot bans them based on advertising**.


Also, nobody that's going to be okay with getting boosted cares about their ranked. They just want rewards and bragging rights. 

If someone's in 'elo hell' and getting boosted due to that, they'll quickly realize it wasn't 'elo hell'. They were just bad.

I disagree with the last portion, elo hell does exist, it's perfectly possible to do well in a game, play near perfectly, secure objectives, get pentas, and not feed, but still lose because two of your lanes fed and won't gather for objectives.  Part of the reason why boosting can occur isn't because you're bad, but rather that you don't have bad teammates.

And I'd disagree with the entirety of what you said because the statistical averages of what your argument implies means that boosting should not be possible. 

'elo hell' might keep you down ~100 MMR at most. A gold 1 will not be held back in silver due to 'elo hell'. Even if you are held back that 100 MMR, it will not be for long.

If your argument was "I was silver/gold/plat last year", and you can't reach the same the next year, its because A) You got lucky and actually don't belong there B) You got worse at the game relative to the average playerbase C)Your champions are worse and you refuse to play others and are not significantly ahead of your current MMR in skill.

Elo hell is a myth that only still exists because "STATISTICS SAY ITS POSSIBLE!! SEE ITS REAL1!!!1!"

If you're not playing someone like Zed and can't 1v5 carry with the champion, try something called not starving the rest of your team. Its when you mention the word sell. They cant stop people from smurfing and boosting a lower level player up even tho they are against boosting. But im pretty sure if they can prove money was involved then they have proof boosting was involved and they would probably do something about it. 

But my thing about boosting is...whats the point?

1. If you are bronze and someone boosts you up to gold or higher or even just silver. What is the point because once they hand back over the account and you have to play the games yourself against people you do not belong with....now you will be getting smashed every game. Which will not be fun...so for what? A silver or gold boarder next season?

2. Again the fun....it takes the fun out of earning it yourself.

I was silver season 4.......gold bronze in season 5 promos and for some reason never made it back out.

Got B5 after going 7-2 in my promos this season (10th game was not counted because of Loss Prevention)

Im now starting my B2 promos and having a blast trying to move up. 

Why let someone else have the fun for you just to suffer misery once they get you to a level you can not compete at?

So people can have bragging rights and end of year rewards. They would rather pay for it now and get it, than having to go through hundreds of games for it in the long road in which they probably wouldn't get it on their own anyways.

If you have a gold border and play like bronze people will expect more from you but you can never live up to it.
Getting boosted to an elo that you do not belong in is a lose-lose situation.
Getting to Gold or higher playing one role/champion and then playing a different one provides similar false expectations.
